docs.snippet: In the United States, the social media giant has been an advocate of equal treatment of all Internet content. In India, regulators who share that belief have effectively blocked a free Facebook service.

headline.main: Daily Report: A Net Neutrality Setback for Facebook in India

docs.abstract: In the United States, the social media giant has been an advocate of equal treatment of all Internet content. In India, regulators who share that belief have effectively blocked a free Facebook service.

docs.snippet: Two explosions at a market in the mostly Shiite neighborhood of Shaab in Baghdad killed dozens and wounded many others, officials said. The suicide attack was the latest in a wave of sectarian violence.
GIFs cannot just be uploaded directly to Facebook. Instead, they need to be linked to from their location on the web.
Mike Isaac, a New York Times technology reporter, joins to talk about Facebook’s decision to comply with Chinese censorship regulations.
Facebook’s video audience is rapidly growing. But it is only a step toward a great vision for virtual reality.

headline.print_headline: Facebook to Build a V.R. Network
headline.main: Facebook Building a Network for Virtual Reality

docs.abstract: Facebook’s video audience is rapidly growing. But it is only a step toward a great vision for virtual reality.

docs.snippet: Mark Zuckerberg denounced remarks by Mr. Andreessen on Twitter that Indians were being shortsighted by banning Facebook’s Free Basics project.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Disavows Andreessen’s Comments on India
headline.main: Marc Andreessen Apologizes After Facebook Disavows India Comments

docs.abstract: Venture capitalist Marc Andreessen defends Facebook's Free Basics initiative that is aimed at poorer people in countries like India, saying nation's ban of service is shortsighted; Facebook disavows his comments.

docs.snippet: The arrest of the executive, Diego Dzodan, comes as a debate over the access that law enforcement officials should get to tech companies’ data has escalated.

headline.print_headline: Brazilian Police Arrest a Facebook Executive in a WhatsApp Data Access Case
headline.main: Brazil Arrests Facebook Executive in WhatsApp Data Access Case

docs.abstract: Federal police in Brazil arrest Facebook vice president Diego Dzodan after company failed to comply with judge's order to turn over information from WhatsApp messaging account linked to drug trafficking investigation.

docs.snippet: The E.U. is flawed. But the dream is noble and still worth the fight. It did not deserve to be trashed by hucksters.

headline.main: Britain to Leave Europe for a Lie

docs.snippet: Just think of yourself as being that much closer to the actor Kevin Bacon.

headline.main: Six Degrees of Separation? Facebook Finds a Smaller Number

docs.snippet: India has banned free mobile programs that allow Internet access only to certain services, a strategy employed by Facebook with its Free Basics project that was called antithetical to net neutrality.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Loses Battle in India on Free Web Use
headline.main: Facebook Loses a Battle in India Over Its Free Basics Program

docs.abstract: Indian regulators ban free mobile data programs that prefer some Internet services over others; regulations, following public debate over how to get Internet to poorest Indians, block Facebook's Free Basics program, which offers no-fee access to some services.
